IncidentArtifactREST Resource

Endpoints for managing an incident's artifacts.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/artifacts

Gets the list of artifacts associated with the specified incident.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
inc_id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json IncidentArtifactDTO (JSON) Returns a list of artifact objects.

POST /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/artifacts

Creates a new artifact on an incident.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
inc_id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json IncidentArtifactDTO (JSON) The artifact data. Note that the "value" property can contain multiple values separated by whitespace for artifact types that support multiple values (the constDTO.artifact_types will return a list of artifact types and each object has an is_multi_aware that indicates whether multiple values are supported). This capability is useful if you want to include a list of, say, IP addresses that are to be added to the incident.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json IncidentArtifactDTO (JSON) Echos back the artifact as well as any dependent artifcats that were automatically created.

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/artifacts/{artifact_id}

Saves changes to an artifact.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
artifact_id path The artifact ID. int
inc_id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json IncidentArtifactDTO (JSON) The artifact data to save.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type
application/json IncidentArtifactDTO (JSON)

POST /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/artifacts/{artifact_id}/copy

Create a new artifact based on an existing artifact.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
artifact_id path The existing artifact ID. int
inc_id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json IncidentArtifactDTO (JSON) Artifact data that indicates what incident the copied artifact should belong to. Also can be used to specify fields that override the fields in the existing artifact
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type
application/json IncidentArtifactDTO (JSON)

GET /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/artifacts/{artifact_id}/contents

Retrieves the actual contents of an artifact attachment using a GET. If you cannot specify the CSRF token as a "X-sess-id" header, then use the POST variant and supply a "csrf" form field parameter.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
artifact_id path int
inc_id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json object (JSON) Returns the attachment contents. The Content-Type, Content-Length and Content-disposition headers are set.
text/html (custom)

POST /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/artifacts/{artifact_id}/contents

Retrieves the actual contents of an artifact attachment using a POST (allows the "csrf" form field parameter to be specified in cases where the client cannot send it as a header).

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
csrfToken formdata  
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

inc_id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int

text/html (custom)

POST /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/artifacts/files

Uploads an attachment as an artifact. The artifact JSON data must be included in the "artifact" form data field.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
artifactJSON formdata  
bodyPart formdata  
csrfToken formdata  
fileDetail formdata  
uploadedInputStream formdata  
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
inc_id path int
org_id path The organization ID. int
type query The type of output you would like. This can be either "xml" or "json".  
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json IncidentArtifactDTO (JSON) Information about the added artifact.
text/plain (custom)

GET /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/artifacts/{artifact_id}/whois

This method has been deprecated.

Retrieves the an artifact's domain WHOIS record using a GET.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
artifact_id path int
inc_id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json WhoisDTO (JSON) Returns the WHOIS record, or null if the record cannot be found.

POST /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/artifacts/{artifact_id}/whois

Retrieves the an artifact's domain WHOIS record using a POST.
